dict.string:
Returns a structure containing the results from multiple search paths, separated by commas. Optionally specify labels for the new structure with equal signs and optionally cluster label sub-groups with a forward slash.
For example, the path "id = story_id, user/name = actors.0.name.text, user/age = actors.0.age" would yield a structure with two top-level keys ("id" and "user") and two sub-level keys ("name" and "age" within "user"). All of the leaf-node children (in this example, "id", "name" and "age") will contain the values of their respective search path values.
Origami http://origami.facebook.com/
